metadata.title: CVE-2024-35835 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/mlx5e: fix a double-free in arfs_create_groups When `in` allocated bykvzalloc fails, arfs_create_groups will free ft->g and return an error.However, arfs_create_table, the only caller of arfs_create_groups, willhold this error and call to mlx5e_destroy_flow_table, in which the ft->gwill be freed again.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35835` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-228-generic - 4.15.0-228.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-228-generic - 4.15.0-228.240
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-228-lowlatency - 4.15.0-228.240
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1155-kvm - 4.15.0-1155.160
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1172-aws - 4.15.0-1172.185
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1180-azure - 4.15.0-1180.195
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1165-gcp - 4.15.0-1165.182
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1134-oracle - 4.15.0-1134.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-228.240').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-181.201~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1155.160').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1172.185').
